citation.article-title: Novel facultative anaerobic acidotolerant Telmatospirillum siberiense gen. nov. sp. nov. isolated from mesotrophic fen.

p.s: Description of Telmatospirillum siberiense sp. nov.
Telmatospirillum siberiense (si.be.ri.en'se. N.L. neut. adj. siberiense, from or pertaining to Siberia (Russia)). All of the characteristics mentioned above.
Gram-negative vibrio to spirilla 0.2–0.6 μm in diameter, motile by means of 1–2 polar or subpolar flagella.
Circular shaped cells and coccoid bodies form in old cultures.
Cells produce small brown, beige or pink colonies on anoxic citrate agar medium.
Major cellular fatty acids are 18:1 ω7c, 17:0 cyclopropane and 16:0.
Energy is provided via fermentation (anoxic conditions) or respiratory metabolism under microaerophilic conditions with oxygen pressure less than 5 kPa.

The type strain of this species assimilates pyruvate, α-ketoglutarate, succinate, gluconate, fumarate and glucose and did not assimilate formate, acetate, propionate, oxalate, oxaloacetate, ethanol and methanol under anoxic conditions.
Acetate, oxalate, ethanol and methanol support microaerophilic growth.
Optimum growth temperature is 25–28 °C; pH optimum is 5.7–6.5.
Sensitive to potassium phosphate (but not NaCl) at concentration higher than 100 mM.
The mole G+C ratio of the DNA of the type strain is 64%.
This bacterium was isolated from mesotrophic Siberian fen as a component of methanogenic consortia.
Notes: Strains 26-4b1, 26-2 and K-1 have been deposited in the ATCC and DSMZ, as strains =BAA-1305T; =BAA-1306; =BAA-1307; =DSM 18240T; =DSM 18242; =DSM 18241.

Nucleotide sequence data reported are available in GenBank database under the accession numbers: AF524863, DQ482046, DQ482047 for strain 26-4b1; DQ094180 for strain 26-2; DQ094181, DQ482048, DQ482049 for strain K-1; DQ482050 for Magnetospirillum gryphiswaldense strain MSR-1T and DQ482051 for Phaeospirillum fulvum strain 5K.
